meanings.definition: To make something appear larger than it is.
meanings.sent1: She was magnifying the tiny details on the leaf.
meanings.sent2: Using a magnifying glass, he examined the small insect closely.
meanings.sent3: The detective magnifying the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her smile magnifying the beauty of the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes magnifying the colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To increase the importance or reputation of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The award ceremony was magnifying his achievements in the field.
meanings.sent2: Her hard work magnifying her value to the company.
meanings.sent3: The rumor mill magnifying the gossip about the celebrity.
meanings.sent4: The new policy magnifying the company's commitment to sustainability.
meanings.sent5: His speech magnifying the impact of community service.

meanings.definition: A lens or other optical device that makes an object appear larger.
meanings.sent1: She used a magnifying glass to read the small print.
meanings.sent2: The detective examined the evidence through the magnifying lens.
meanings.sent3: The curious child played with the magnifying glass in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The jeweler inspected the diamond under the magnifying lens.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the specimen under the magnifying glass.
